title: 1Password discloses security incident linked to Okta breach
description: 1Password, a popular password management platform used by over 100,000 businesses, suffered a security breach after hackers gained access to its Okta ID management tenant. [...]

title: University of Michigan employee, student data stolen in cyberattack
description: The University of Michigan says in a statement today that they suffered a data breach after hackers broke into its network in August and accessed systems with information belonging to students, applicants, alumni, donors, employees, patients, and research study participants. [...]

title: Palestine crypto donation scams emerge amid Israel-Hamas war
description: As thousands of civilians die amid the deadly Israel-Hamas war, scammers are capitalizing on the horrific events to collect donations by pretending to be legitimate charities. BleepingComputer has come across several posts on X (formerly Twitter), Telegram and Instagram where scammers list dubious cryptocurrency wallet addresses. [...]

title: Citrix warns admins to patch NetScaler CVE-2023-4966 bug immediately
description: Citrix warned admins today to secure all NetScaler ADC and Gateway appliances immediately against ongoing attacks exploiting the CVE-2023-4966 vulnerability. [...]

title: US energy firm shares how Akira ransomware hacked its systems
description: In a rare display of transparency, US energy services firm BHI Energy details how the Akira ransomware operation breached their networks and stole the data during the attack. [...]

title: Spain arrests 34 cybercriminals who stole data of 4 million people
description: The Spanish National Police have dismantled a cybercriminal organization that carried out a variety of computer scams to steal and monetize the data of over four million people. [...]

title: Cisco patches IOS XE zero-days used to hack over 50,000 devices
description: Cisco has addressed the two vulnerabilities (CVE-2023-20198 and CVE-2023-20273) that hackers exploited to compromise tens of thousands of IOS XE devices over the past week. [...]

title: QNAP takes down server behind widespread brute-force attacks
description: QNAP took down a malicious server used in widespread brute-force attacks targeting Internet-exposed NAS (network-attached storage) devices with weak passwords. [...]

title: City of Philadelphia discloses data breach after five months
description: The City of Philadelphia is investigating a data breach after attackers "may have gained access" to City email accounts containing personal and protected health information five months ago, in May. [...]

title: D.C. Board of Elections: Hackers may have breached entire voter roll
description: The District of Columbia Board of Elections (DCBOE) says that a threat actor who breached a web server operated by the DataNet Systems hosting provider in early October may have obtained access to the personal information of all registered voters. [...]
